meanings.definition: A person who engages in telemarketing.
meanings.sent1: The telemarkers called to offer a new phone plan.
meanings.sent2: Telemarkers often work in call centers to make sales calls.
meanings.sent3: The telemarkers tried to sell a vacuum cleaner to a cat!
meanings.sent4: The telemarkers were like persistent ants, always trying to make a sale.
meanings.sent5: The image of telemarkers in my mind is of people in headsets making calls all day.

meanings.definition: The act of making unsolicited phone calls to sell products or services.
meanings.sent1: I received a telemarkers call about a new credit card offer.
meanings.sent2: Telemarkers can be quite persistent in trying to sell you something.
meanings.sent3: The telemarkers interrupted dinner to offer a discount on socks.
meanings.sent4: The constant ringing of the phone felt like a swarm of telemarkers invading.
meanings.sent5: The word 'telemarkers' brings to mind those annoying sales calls during dinner.
